paper_abstract: We study two natural models of randomly generated constraint satisfaction problems. We determine how quickly the domain size must grow with n to ensure that these models are robust in the sense that they exhibit a non-trivial threshold of satisfiability, and we determine the asymptotic order of that threshold. We also provide resolution complexity lower bounds for these models. One of our results immediately yields a theorem regarding homomorphisms between two random graphs. (c) 2006 Wiley Periodicals, Inc.
paper_title: The satisfiability threshold for randomly generated binary constraint satisfaction problems
